website_summaries.verdict: Connect up to four HDMI compatible devices and switch it up with the click of a button.
pros: A sleek-looking box with high-quality components
The Picture in Picture (PiP) mode lets you keep track of your other inputs and easily switch between them
Manual switch option is there in case the remote gets lost
cons: Users report the signal can  unexpectedly drop out

customer_reviews.title: Great remote controlled HDMI switch
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Packaging was very will done. Unit replaced a manual three way HDMI switch which required getting up and going to the tv to change. Has six small led status lights that remain on; power light, plus five HDMI status, one out and four in. With all cables hooked up the power on is red, HDMI out is green, the HDMI ports lights will show either red or if selected blue. The one critique I would make of their design is matching up the remote control buttons which are labeled IN1,IN2, IN3, IN4 to the box stratus lights is HDMI port 1 is to the far right.
customer_reviews.author: Nightflyer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure interconnected devices are powered on!
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression is positive. During install I failed to recognize that the devices must be powered on for the switch to recognize devices are connected to it. I called amazon tech support and was informed a replacement will be sent. I received the replacement 24 hrs later and tested it out with devices on this time. The replacement was really not necessary because an error was made on my part. In summary the product is positive. When Interconnected devices are powered on the input Led for each device is red. When u select the input, the led turns blue.
customer_reviews.author: C3Armory

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd switch I am trying. The previous ones only worked intermittently and the remote worked more on my fan in the room than it did on the actual switch. Thus far - quality is great, remote control works great! My only complaint is that the lights are bright in my bedroom - but in this review I see an option to review sleep mode. . . .Only rated 2 stars on that feature because I had no idea it even had a sleep mode. . .so I will look for some instructions and test that out as well. . . chances are that's not a fair rating!
customer_reviews.author: Birgitt B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked with Samsung TV
customer_reviews.text: I have two Samsung TVs, and not enough HDMI ports for everything. I was able to connect a Blu Ray player, TiVo Mini, Apple TV, and a PS3 with no issues. The picture looks fantastic! Only time will tell how long the box will last, though.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Easy to install and use. My receive doesn't have enough HDMI ports and this helps me add in the products I need. I have it set up with an AppleTV, PlayStation 4, Wii U, and an additional long HDMI cable I keep by the couch to plug my PC in and project to the TV. The little remote that it comes with works really well, although I rarely need to use it. The switch/hub usually changed to the proper port when I power up another device.
customer_reviews.author: RoscoXIV

customer_reviews.title: A great HDMI switch BUT not for 4K gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these switches for a year and half now and they are fantastic. Never once had an issue and I strongly recommend them. HOWEVER. If you are you are looking to upgrade to the PS4 Pro, Xbox One X, or play games at 4K on PC then these WILL NOT work. These switches do however work with HDR at 1080p/60hz. You will need a 4K@60hz switch that also supports HDCP 2.2 and HDR.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan H. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: This turned into a steaming pile very quickly. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This turned into a steaming pile very quickly. It no longer works at all. I need to pull the plug to restart it each time I need to change to the active HDMI channel. I had high hope that it would work with my Samsung 4K tv but I was wrong. I would not buy this product again. It has trouble with Apple TV 4K. Do Not Buy this. My money is gone, don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: TheBasicPilot

customer_reviews.title: simple to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use...hooked up to a wii u, Nintendo switch and snes classic. Also tested on my ps4 pro and xbox 1 S. switching is fast and the included remote is responsive. the AC adapter is 5 volt and has a usb plug at one end with a wall adapter....if you have a usb plug on a surge protector or another device, it can save you from using an outlet. plan to test hdr passthrough and 4k once my new TV arrives and will update then.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T.

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe this works so well. I don't know it is there.
customer_reviews.text: This works exceptionally on my 2016 LG 4k TV and video gaming devices. Have been wanting to get a HDMI switch since I got a TV but have read they don't work. Someone recommended this as a good switch that works with 4k everything but HDR. They are totally right. Have this hooked up to my Wii U, Computer with Nvidia 1060, Xbox 360, Switch and Steam Link. They all work flawlessly, including the CEC Link where you turn on your switch and the TV will turn on. This does not work with HDR but hopefully you have another HDMI port for that.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Turn your Computer Display into a bonafide Television
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently using 3, of the 4, ports at the moment and the transition between the different inputs is seamless. The picture-in-picture feature is cool, at first, but it's really nothing more than a gimmick. So, don't buy it based on this single feature alone. I currently have an Xbox One S, a laptop (via thunderbolt dock) and a nintendo switch. As for the display, it's a Lenovo 23-inch computer monitor with an auxiliary output for sound. As a single person living in a small apartment this is truly a wonderful configuration that spares me from purchasing a dedicated TV to do nothing more than what I already do on a computer (i.e. Netflix, Hulu, etc).
customer_reviews.author: dromatriptan

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple gaming consoles
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. Just about everything now a days used HDMI ports. Most TV's have two to four and thats about it. If you have kids and have multiple gaming consoles, you know what I am talking about. This solved my problems and what I like best about this particular brand and model is that it automatically switches to the input that you have on. All I have to do is go to the TV input which has this connected, and I do not manually have to select which input within the switch that I want, it just goes to what is connected and turned on. One of the best purchases I have made.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Vee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Extremely Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This device has made the entertainment set-up in my household so much more convenient. Instead of constantly searching for the TV remote to change inputs, this thing automatically detects which device has been most recently activated and immediately switches to that input. When you turn it off, it switches back to whichever input was used last! I hardly have to touch a remote at all anymore. The Picture In Picture feature works amazingly well, too. Very helpful if you want to play video games during a commercial break of a live sports event, for example. Remote works very well and is very responsive. I can't believed I lived without this thing for so long.
customer_reviews.author: James Ryall

customer_reviews.title: Great Headache relief
customer_reviews.text: Was able to include this switcher for my Logitech Harmony One remote. Now my wife can switch from DVD to TV and back without having to worry about losing the picture. Great Headache relief. One Note - Switching from Samsung DVD player to Samsung TV (using Channel Master DVR) has a hiccup. The DVD does a disconnect anywhere device in the process and throws the TV switch to HDMI 1 off. Have to completely turn off the DVD devices and then Start the DVR devices. Going from TV to DVD does work without a hitch though.
customer_reviews.author: z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little device
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little device! I have everything plugged into HDMI1 and can change it with the push of a button. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: mbeam

customer_reviews.title: I love this device for the setup I have!
customer_reviews.text: This device was perfect for my computer, server, and PS4 setup. The PIP function is great to have on this device because of my dual monitor setup while I'm waiting for Battlefield 1 to load the game I can switch over to my computer and enabled PIP so I can see when Battlefield 1 has loaded the game while working on my computer. All I can say is this is an amazing device and aesthetically wise it looks great. This is a great buy and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: STEPHAINE COURTNEY

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my issue
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI switch works fantastic. I have my cable box and blue-ray player hooked up to it. I originally had the blue-ray player and an Amazon fire- stick hooked up to the HDMI switch. But, there was no sound when the fire-stick was used. I removed the fire-stick and inserted it directly into the TV HDMI port. The cable box was then added to the HDMI Switch. This way, everything works fine and the picture is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DIY

customer_reviews.title: EASY to setup and Use! worked with Amazon Fire, PlayStation and cable box.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, clearly marked. This was about as easy to set up as it gets. I had another 3 port switch that did not work with an Amazon Fire TV box, this one does. I have my sons Playstation (3&4) and Amazon Fire and Cable box all hooked up to this so that he only has to switch between feeds to get what he wants. And it works great. Easy, small form factor also. It is not double stacked like the photo, they are just showing you the two sides. This worked great and took minutes to set up!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Works for high definition Blue Ray
customer_reviews.text: This HDMI switch works with my high definition blue ray. I had previously bought a less expensive unit, that worked with Wii, xbox, laptop, but would not work for the blue ray. I upgraded to this unit and it works will with all the devices including the blue ray. I'm very happy with it. Autosenses what input is powered on and switches to it (haven't tried having multiple inputs powered simultaneously, also have not used the remote. I bought short (1.5') HDMI high speed cables to connect all the inputs to the sources, then a 3' high speed on the output to the TV. My devices are: WiiU, xBox360, Sony Blue-ray, Samsung TV
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 Weeks of Operation and Total Failure!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Zettaguard 4K x 2K 4 Port HDMI Switch from Amazon. Within 3 weeks the unit stopped working with just a 'flashing power light' blinking incessantly. I'd power it down and re-boot, it would appear normal for 2-3 minutes then would become inoperable again! I contacted Zettaguard via e-mail on their website under 'Support' a week ago.....no response! Either my unit is a lemon or the product is of poor quality. This is the first product bought through Amazon that gave me any operational issues after purchase. I would not buy any Zettaguard product again due to poor operation and totally worthless Tech Support!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: we love this hdmi switcher it works great we connected all ...
customer_reviews.text: we love this hdmi switcher it works great we connected all three game consoles - ps4 - wii u - nintendo switch
customer_reviews.author: edwardsonnysturgis

customer_reviews.title: No.
customer_reviews.text: Works really good. I programmed my harmony remote for it so i dont have to use the flimsy remote that came with it. It functions well and does what its supposed to do. Used it to run HDMI to my new soundbar from various sources. Update: Worked for 3 weeks and then was unusable. Called and e mailed their listed customer support and never heard back. Total piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Kunkel Family

customer_reviews.title: This is not a 4K by 2K switch
customer_reviews.text: Good switch for 1080p, this however is not a 4K switch. It cannot send 4K signal from any device I own in 4K (Xbox One S, PS4 Pro, MacBook Pro). Everything is sent as 1080p - 60 Hz
customer_reviews.author: RJ Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Solved my multiple HDMI input issues
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Solved my multiple HDMI input issues. My 4K TV has only three HDMI inputs and I needed five. I tried a couple other HDMI switcher options but had issues with my PS4 console not being recognized. No problems here. Quality product for the $.
customer_reviews.author: RWJ

customer_reviews.title: No good. Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: No good. Doesn't work. My PS4 Pro and Xbox One X wont pick up 4k UHD on my LG 4K tv. Tried everything. Switched the wires. Used different devices. But when i turn off my uhd on my tv then the thing picks up the picture. It only picks up hd. Its not for 4k! False advertisement!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Two things wrong with this
customer_reviews.text: First thing is that the remote had the same Chanel as my sound bar, so any time I wanted to change the volume the HDMI port would change. Second thing that was terrible was that the volume would cut out every 15 or so minutes, and often the picture would shut off completely.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Grimmett

customer_reviews.title: PIP is nice feature, but doesn't work with 4K
customer_reviews.text: Works great since I never seem to have enough HDMI inputs. Woked fine with 4K video from my laptop and UHD security DVR. Would get 5 starts if they disclosed the fact that PIP feature doesn't work with 4K video. The PIP works great on 1080p and is nicer than I'd have expected and almost required since there little space near the input buttons for lables. The remote seems flimsy and uses a some what harder to find battery than necessary. Make it a bit larger to use a common 2032 instead of the 2025 cell would be better. The button layout could have been better so stick-on labels could be added next to the four selection buttons.
customer_reviews.author: walter b.

customer_reviews.title: Works but has problem
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for a week or so and then it would simply cut out for 3 to 5 seconds no audio no video then click back on; used it on different inputs and different sources always the same loss of video and audio for the 3 to 5 second interval? No set time line could go for days without a problem and then start again very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Native

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my new Samsung 65" Class TU7000 Crystal UHD 4K Smart TV (2020)
customer_reviews.text: Like many people I have multiple devices that I need to connect via hdmi to my tv. I had two other hdmi switches that I had been using on my old Samsung HD TV, but had problems with this new set. I could not connect my computer with the other switches. This switch worked with my computer the first time with no problem. I have my fire tv stick, spectrum cable box, x-box and dell computer all connected on this and they work great. I haven't had it very long, so I can't comment on longevity, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: HDMI 1.4 not HDR compatible
customer_reviews.text: This product has alot of items going for it, the top most description shows HDCP 2.2 and then the product description further down says HDCP 1.4 (this needs to be fixed, as its referring to the HDMI port and not HDCP capability) This was not sufficient for me as i needed the HDR capabilities of HDMI 2.0 and above, so i returned it for the koopman 4 port HDMI 2.0 HDR10 switch instead
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: Works BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: Something happens in between the switcher and the devices, that creates a feedback in and out. For example, I have my cable provider, the ps4, and the pc. Whenever I connect the PC, the switch comes back to life, that awakens the ps4, so the switch chooses to show the ps4, meanwhile since there is no output the TV decides to switch to air channels. So I have to wait for the entire circus to settle and then switch back to the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the zettaguard hdmi switch because it advertised intelligent switching based on which device was current powered on. I can't say that the intelligent switching feature is perfect, but the device also comes with a remote and has a mechanical button on the interface to work around that. I've found myself using the remote more often than not, but that's ok because at the price I paid I don't mind. I'm using this device to switch between my Dish receiver and a Fire TV. Picture quality and sound are perfect with no degradation and I have the ability to expand it to two other devices still if/when needed.
customer_reviews.author: C^2

customer_reviews.title: Spontaneous Input Switching, LEDs too bright
customer_reviews.text: 1. It will spontaneously change inputs a few times a minute and/or drop the audio but keep the picture. The longest time I've had it running without this happening was approximately 30 minutes. 2. The remote requires line of sight to the switch to operate it which means it has to be out in the open. That wouldn't be a problem if the LEDs weren't so bright. I have a shelf where the switch must sit which is also right about eye level when you're seated so the LEDs are right in your eyes. I will be returning this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: John Durden

customer_reviews.title: Does not appear to work as a HDCP 2.2 pass-through.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work as advertised. It works with all my devices, but NOT my Playstation 4 Pro. It is advertised as working with it, however, it appears that is is not HDCP 2.2 compliant. Maybe I missed that somewhere in the description. Via the switch, my TV acknowledges the ps4 is connected and powered on (it's a sony tv, so it even knows that it is seeing a ps4). I get no sound or picture though. Everything else seems fine. I will keep playing with it and update this review if I figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor implementation.  Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: 4 video streams on 1 screen. Sounds like a great idea. Best implementation would be split screen with 1 large and three small images. Not with this product. It does Picture In Picture (PIP), where 3 videos overlap and hide parts of the full screen main video. Product description shows three large images over most of left half of screen. But that's not what you get. You really get three very small barely visible images in part of the left half of the screen, overlapping the full screen image. The copy writer probably never even saw the product. Complete waste of time and money. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: There appears to be a design flaw. If the switch loses signal to a device connected to it, even for a second, the device has to be rebooted or reset. I had 2 of them do the same thing, when a device switched screens for more than a second the signal would drop and the switch would automatically change to another input. When I would try to go back to the original input it would not show up on the screen. I would have to reset the input device and power cycle the switch in order to restore the picture.
customer_reviews.author: GopherGuy75

customer_reviews.title: It was great...while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Edited Nov 28, 2019 It was a great switch while it lasted...but it just gave up the ghost. There was no warning, it just stopped working yesterday. I know nothing is made to last anymore but 5 months is just not acceptable. I can no longer recommend this product. ----------------------------------- I have nothing but good things to say about this switch box. Setup was flawless - plug and play. We'll see how long it lasts but at this point I'm very happy with it. It allows 4 devices to be connected to a single HDMI port on my TV at a very reasonable price. The Picture-In-Picture is a cool feature that I didn't to find at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Works with my older plasma screen tv
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hub because the cheaper one I had before would randomly change to another port in the middle of watching a movie or playing games. I have not had one issue with this device randomly switching on me. It's a sturdy feeling device and the number of available ports is sufficient for the number of devices that I need to route to my tv. Even though I have a 1080p plasma screen, I got this 4K router because, why not! Only down side is that there was no HDMI cord provided with the switch. I needed to purchase a separate one to get this set up. Otherwise, good value for the money. I'd recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Rogan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Amazon Fire Stick
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to set up! I love the little remote. Worked in minutes. I did read a review that said the fire stick stays on in the background when plugged to this device and may affect the life of the stick. So, I unplug at night. Also, you do need to purchase a HDMI cord to connect it to the TV and then connect your devices to the box. Can someone tell me if this is true? Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches54

customer_reviews.title: Wont work with all hdmi equipment
customer_reviews.text: Passes securty camera data to the tv successfully but will not pass a (my) dvd signal to the tv. The tv and dvd player are both Samsung products that are hdmi 2.1 spec. Compliant. The switch is only 1.4 compliant. I spoke to Samsung's tech support. They do not support or recommend any switch between the units. The reason given, Only a direct connection will work because a handshake sequence takes place between the units to negotiate frame rate and size. This requires the connection to be bidirectional and the timing for this sequence is critical.
customer_reviews.author: Orbit

customer_reviews.title: PIP Isn't As Expected
customer_reviews.text: The picture in picture feature is the only reason I got this one versus another product. PIP doesn't apparently work when I am focusing on my laptop desktop and trying to have another device in PIP. I wanted to work while having the cable input in PIP. Also the PIP windows are extremely small. The product works as advertised but the PIP is a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Alex E

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a "seamless" switcher.
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI signal is broken during the switch between sources, causing the projector to have to re-negotiate the HDMI signal. This creates a delay and a warning from the projector which gets displayed for all to see. DO NOT BUY this if you want a smooth transition between sources, it will NOT do what you want it to do. From the description..."Connects up to 3 HDMI source components to a single HDMI input for seamless transitions between gaming, television and more" This is a lie. Sending this back...
customer_reviews.author: Digital V.

customer_reviews.title: Remote control doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself seems to work as advertised, although I'm not stressing it with 4k video, only regular HD. The problem is, and it's a major problem, is that the remote control is essentially useless - and almost always doesn't work. The battery in the remote arrived to me dead, so after replacing that, the remote worked for a few days. And within a day or two, it became very unreliable - sometimes working, and sometimes not. And now, the remote doesn't seem to work at all.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelX

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work perfect
customer_reviews.text: This product is ok but doesn't work very well for me. The IR capabilities are off. The remote never seems to work on this. I keep a fresh battery in it but I can't easily switch between input channels. The button on device still works. I'll be looking for another option to replace this simply due to the remote function lacking. Picture quality seems fine. No issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Easily worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it does, and does it well. I have my tv/ps4/remote computer access all plugged into one hdmi input, it’s amazing. I ran my sound bar to my ps4 and bluetoothed it to my dish hopper 3, I’ve never been able to get them both to work with the sound bar because it didn’t like the daisy chain. The PiP thing is cool, if not kind of useless. The remote works but leaves a lot to be desired. I wish it was bigger to make it a little harder to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mirelez

customer_reviews.title: A mess with multi DVRs
customer_reviews.text: Nice form factor and packaging. The unit changes inputs whenever one of my DVRs turns on OR OFF. When watching content on one DVR and another DVR turns off the unit switches to the (now blank/no signal) DVR that just switched off! Switching from input to input frequently results in no audio, a blank screen. or white noise... usually requiring a reset. Turning the TV off, then on usually restores the connection .. else unplug/replug the switch unit. [Note: there's no on/off switch on the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Live Sound Guy 106

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Advertising - NOT HDMI 2.2 4K Compatible
customer_reviews.text: Dropped all my inputs down to 1080p. Roku identified right away that the unit was not compatible with 2.2, yet there it is in print. Wrong! Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: An observer

customer_reviews.title: Nice HDMI 4 port switch with Picture-in-Picture, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this hdmi 4 port switch (4 in, 1 out). I have a few PC Desktops and mac-minis I use for building and testing things. Previously I had to unplug 1 server and plug in the other to see the display, or fumble with the monitor input switch, now I have picture-in-picture of my 4 systems, windows 10, macos, linux servers and can switch between them easily, and automatically as they boot, very cool. surprised it works so well since it was pretty inexpensive. I haven't tested all the HDMI related passthrough (audio, hdmi-cec, or 4k yet), I'm buying another one for my home entertainment system (appletv, chromecast, amazon fire stick, dish).
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Apple TV.
customer_reviews.text: In retrospect, this is an oversight on my part. I should have guessed that these kinds of products would be hit-or-miss with Apple products. Unfortunately, this does not work with my Apple TV. I'm keeping it because it still works with our Nintendo and Blu-Ray player. The remote control is also pretty dingy, I worry that I'll break it or something. Overall, I'm not satisfied with this but, as I said, I feel that it's more on me than anything. I'm keeping my 2-star rating, though, because I still feel that these kinds of products should work universally.
customer_reviews.author: Mozely

customer_reviews.title: FRAUDULENT claim of HDCP 2.2
customer_reviews.text: The main description says HDCP 2.2 compatible. It isn't. Looking deep into the fine print, it claims 1.4 support. Most people are going to read the main description and get ripped off (like me).
customer_reviews.author: Greg DeMent

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace a previous switch which had stopped working, not to mention that I needed an extra port. This is currently handling 3 game consoles and a cable box. So far it's working fine, and the picture-in-picture feature is pretty cool. My only complaint is that the field of view for the remote control's infrared beam seems to be a bit narrow, I have to almost be directly in front of the box to use the remote control, but that's a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Rob P.

customer_reviews.title: Discrepancies between the description and the actual box
customer_reviews.text: From the Amazon Web Page for Zettaguard 4x1 HDMI Switch "Supports video format up to 4k2k@60hz with 24bit RGB/YCBCR 4:4:4/YCBCR 4:2:2; ..." The box indicates that the switch is complaint with HDMI 1.4a and that the switch supports resolutions up @30Hz. Please see picture. The box does not make reference to HDCP, the description on the Amazon web page says that it is compliant with HDCP 2.2 Could the seller please clarify the discrepancy.
customer_reviews.author: rcalmar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much all the features I chose this do not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Sleep mode is annoying if you have a machine wake up when your doing something. The resolution 2k was support when I got it, worked great. Not so much now. Will only support 1080p not 1440. Other that the product is great, but since it can no longer handle 2k res I can no longer use it for my use case. Remote worked great. Pip doesn’t seem to work for me. Pip was one of the features I really wanted to work. It would display a white image or a black one
customer_reviews.author: WhyteNoyse

customer_reviews.title: Great for consoles
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up as a go between since TVs for some reason only like having two HDMI ports. Currently using this for gaming reasons so I don't have to keep swapping out the correct cord for each console. The only things I wish I could change is have one port dedicated for input from the TV or cable box and not have it count against the 4 listed. The other thing the bothers me is that when my Xbox One turns on for automatic updates and triggers channel 2 I wish the device would revert back to channel 1 when the update is complete and the console powers down.
customer_reviews.author: rich kessler photography

customer_reviews.title: Good product so far
customer_reviews.text: Good product so far, I only had it a few days. I've only noticed a few things that don't work for me. The switching from one component to another, the remote is very cheap quality, you have to hold the buttons down very hard. I can see this breaking very soon, that means the whole product will have to be trashed. Also viewing all your devices on your tv screen does not work correctly. Very difficult to control. The remote really sucks on this one.
customer_reviews.author: F. vieira

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Been just watching movies past couple days on my roku. Got a new ps4 game, turned the tv on, grabed the remote for this to switch the hdmi port. Didnt have to push any button it had already switched to my playstation. The remote is kinda small, keep it somewhere you wont lose it. It seems to be a quality product (good casing((doesn’t feel cheap))does what its supposed to do). I don’t have 4k yet so i dunnu how it does with that. I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little problem solver!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to put any kind of HDMI switch on the line going to our TV for fear of picking up noise or losing signal quality however with this switch I do not notice any loss or change in quality. Perfect for your wall-mounted TV that has only one HDMI cable in the wall leading up to it. I like the front panel controls and LED indicators as well as the remote for switching. I have yet to use picture-in-picture but its a cool "bells n' whistles" feature if ever needed for presenting two inputs and switching between them visually. The picture quality and 4 into 1 aspect of this switch alone makes this worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K.

customer_reviews.title: Good for DVD etc.; Not as good for Computer Video
customer_reviews.text: This unit is excellent for "standard" HDMI video sources such as DVD and Blue Ray players, and HD recorders, etc. Picture is clean with no noise or fuzziness and the sound is a direct passthrough. I would recommend the switch for these applications. However, the switch does not perform well with computer video. At high resolutions, the edges of the screen are pushed out(overscan) to the point that you cannot see or mouse click the Start or Settings icons with Win10, and this presents a real problem. You can adjust the screen resolution and some settings will display OK through the switch. For these reasons I would not recommend the switch for computer related applications.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R. Pecora

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't to the main feature I bought it for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an older 1080P switch I’ve been using for 3-4 years now without issue. Wanted the option to use couple different 4k devices including a PS4 Pro and Nvidia Shield TV along with other 1080p devices Both devices does not see this switch as a 4k output. Other quick notes about it. It feels light and cheap. Light enough hdmi cables will move it around. Remote Control is alright, Pip is there just for seeing if a port is active but its small enough to be unusable for viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable so far
customer_reviews.text: If the video doesn’t stop flashing intermittently this is going to get sent back as defective. Not to mention it’s got a terrible habit of just losing signal altogether. Nothing like playing an online game and you lose all video.
customer_reviews.author: Ambrose Valkore

customer_reviews.title: Sounds cuts out
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for almost two months. I have no issue with the picture quality for this device. And I really like that it will switch inputs when I turn on deffert devices that are connected. My one issue with it is that, at least once a week, there is no sound or background noise. This is usually taken care if by unplugging the HDMI cables and plugging back in or unplugging the power, but it's really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Nh5

customer_reviews.title: Works great and works with my Harmony remote!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this HDMI switch to be able to use both a Fire TV Stick and my blue-ray player on the same HDMI port to my Samsung TV, as my TV only has two HDMI ports. This works great and I've had no issues, I don't use the remote that came with the switch as it works with my Harmony remote. I would definitely recommend this product if you have limited HDMI ports and need to add additional devices.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rico

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I've bought at least 3 of these. I bought the first one for my TV. I have an older LCD TV and switchbox (its a 720P LG). Suddenly I couldn't use certain inputs because the HDCP license on the TV or switchbox expired (that shouldn't be allowed to happen). I replaced the previous switchbox with this one and all works again. So I bought a couple more to switch inputs on my older monitors which only have 1 HDMI port each (the monitors are 1920x1200 LCD).
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: works well. do not use for ps4 pro or xbox one x if you want 4k
customer_reviews.text: wasn't aware of the requirement of 4k 60 hz for the xbox one x or ps4 pro, so using this item downgrades it to 1080p otherwise this is a nice unit, it's small and well built. had no issue with the unit otherwise. it auto detects the active item and i found that very helpful. would definately recommend this to anyone who needs an hdmi switch, it just wont work for anything that requires 4k 60 hz
customer_reviews.author: Jason olsen

customer_reviews.title: Dead Remote Battery
customer_reviews.text: Upon initial setup the remote did not work. Was getting ready to return it, but decided to try another battery in the remote. It worked. Sad when they ship a product with a defective battery. The switch works okay, switching between devices is somewhat slow. Xbox One (1080p TV) and Amazon Fire Stick are connected without any issues. 2 star rating because of dead battery is shipped with.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: Simple solution for multiple HDMI inputs
customer_reviews.text: The Zettaguard works great for me. I have a T.V. with only two HDMI ports. I needed to add inputs for my Google Chromecast, X Box One, and Blu-Ray player. I plugged all three into the Zettaguard and switching between them is easy with the remote control. Set up is very simple. All you have to do is plug it into an HDMI port on your T.V., plug in your devices to the Zettaguard, and then set your T.V. to the HDMI port you are plugged into. Then just use the remote to set the channel for the device you want to view. I would recommend this product for people whose devices have out grown their T.V.
customer_reviews.author: Daniell Leipply

customer_reviews.title: Works as described. Wish it came with an HDMI ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Wish it came with an HDMI cable. I had all the HDMI cables going in, but didn't realize I'd need an extra one for the output. Be sure to purchase one if you don't have one laying around.
customer_reviews.author: Frazzley

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was a bit skeptical about purchasing this HDMI port, but I went ahead and did it because I was tired of purchasing lower end models at half the price (GE brand from my local Target, for example). The GE model did it's job for about a year, then died on me. I get what I pay for. The moment I set this one up in my daughters room, I knew that I was truly getting what I paid for. This port is solid. I am usingalong with this port, and my daughter has a 42" LG Smart TV, and I can tell you that made a HUGE difference. 4K all the way. I strongly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JustAFriendFromLA

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cheap garbage
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be a ton of issues with this device actually supporting HDCP 2.2. The initial time you turn on your tv and get everything set up, things seem to work fine - but switching between inputs after you have turned your tv off and back on again, essentially require you to restart the HDMI switch or restart the device you are wanting to use. There seems to be something VERY off with the HDCP negotiation between the switch and the device. I returned the device in light of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: J Carm

customer_reviews.title: Two different units failed within the first week
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good option to provide more HDMI inputs. The first unit I ordered stopped working within the first couple days of taking it out of the box. It would no longer read when an input was active and would not switch between inputs. I exchanged it for another thinking it was a faulty unit. The second unit worked for about a week after I took it out of the box before it also failed. I was already beyond the return window so I did not exchange it for a third unit. It is possible I got two defective units, but either way I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Great device!  Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I love this so far. I plugged in all 3 of my video game systems, and so long as my TV is on the correct source, whatever gaming device I turn on, this device automatically changes to the correct input. I don't really even need the remote unless i have multiple systems playing at once. But that's hard to do using the same TV...my only concern is that having this plugged in seems to decrease the quality of my other inputs, and I don't think that's an issue with my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Desjardins

customer_reviews.title: Short-Lived Digital Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we have just a few too many high-tech devices fighting for a connection to our television (a huge problem, right?). It worked perfectly for a year to a year-and-a-half or so, perfect for what I needed. However, after no more than a year-and-a-half, it completely stopped working. Input isn't recognized, it won't receive power, it won't turn on or change channels, nothing. It was short-lived, and if that's the intended life expectancy, then it is too expensive. I don't recommend if you want something that is long-lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Koremikas

customer_reviews.title: This little switch is Automated!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on a Sunday and Amazon delivered it that night! (How the HECK are they able to do that?!). It was really easy to set up. I never have to use the remote. This switch has some sort of automatic sensing feature. If you turn on a device that is attached to a port, it assumes you want to watch it and automatically switches to that port. When you shut off the device, it switches back, so I haven't had to use the credit card sized remote that comes with it. It is extremely compact. I have had it installed for over 6 months now without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: product is faulty and seller hasn't responded
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this HDMI switcher in January 2020 for approximately $70 and less than 3 months later the product has stopped working. The picture is a black screen for all devices plugged into it. I messaged the company to ask for a refund or a replacement and they have not responded. Do not purchase the product and don't purchase anything from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: This device started out helpful, but has become a real pain. It doesn't detect my PS4 well, and the workaround (turning on more devices and using the picture-in-picture feature on one to "find" the input I actually want) is more irritating than just not having a switcher. Switching is slow, and it isn't easy to get the remote to work. Can't recommend this one,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PIP not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The PIP screens are way to small and pointless at this point. Since that's the main feature that makes this a $40 switch over a $25, I had to give it 3 stars. ( I never wanted to be that person that says "but in the picture it's such and such" but they got me.) I knew the picture would be embellish but not as far as doubling the size of the PIP UI for marketing. On a 60 inch tv I expect a PIP windows to be about 17". It turns out to be 8"
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Returned...
customer_reviews.text: I returned the item because it kept flickering the picture on my television. I plugged my Amazon Fire TV Cube into it and then plugged the switch to my TCL television. Every few seconds it would flicker. I tried new cords at different lengths but it did not solve the problem. I didn't try out the PIP feature. I returned it to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Reid McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a bad one??
customer_reviews.text: Did I get a bad one? I have an xbox one , a plex shield, an atv4 and a local tv box plugged in this then to big Smasung 4K TV. Started by watching NBA - picture just was not as good as going through an AVR blurry/out of focus /lower res maybe. Tried the Xbox and picture was just plain bad. Local cable tv looked normal but it is never very good. And the Shield had issues as it is 4k and worked some of the time. Tried different cable and different connections all with the same result. Pretty much a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Spike M.

customer_reviews.title: Recommendation
customer_reviews.text: Recommend that you reconstruct the HDMI slots with greater space between them in order to accomodate much wider HDMI devices such as Amazon Fire TV Sticks. as it is now, I cannot use the HDMI slot right next to the one that I use the Fire Stick in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires manual selection of Roku via remote control every time; lights too bright in bedroom
customer_reviews.text: It's not possible to play Netflix on our Roku without pressing a button on the remote every time. And there is a series of lights on the front of the thing that are the brightest thing in our bedroom at night. We've become used to pressing the remote, and I put electrical tape over the lights. This is a functional setup enabling us to play DVDs, game console, and Roku all through the same HDMI port.
customer_reviews.author: Busadreamer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware !
customer_reviews.text: This product is simply just ok for me simply because of the fact that it doesn't support HDR. If your planning on using a PS4 Pro or an Xbox One X with this HDMI switch save yourself the trouble and purchase something else. There are many other products out there that support True 4K with HDR @ 60 HZ. Other than that I think the design of the product is great and I actually prefer it over many other HDMI switches but this company seriously needs to upgrade / update there product ASAP. Needless to say I was disappointed at the end. The item has much more potential if it's suited with today's latest and greatest technology.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: It works, does the job, picture is good & so is sound...
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!!! Haven’t had any real problems with it... Have it working with my Logitech Harmony setup 1 touch turns on everything I need... Only problem is I had to turn off the setting on each device that allows control of the tv & audio through the hdmi for example when I press to go back on Apple TV it would change the input on my tv to hdmi 1 (myxfinity box) so when i turned it off it would stay on hdmi 2 where the box is hooked up & would work fine... (sorry if I’m confusing anyone)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Catherman

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not HDMI 2.0 Compliant
customer_reviews.text: I like the features of this switch. The picture in a picture (PIP) function is useful for my application. The switch works fine in HD / 1080P mode, but when I tried to go to full 4K video it was a bridge too far. The vendor indicated it does 4K, but not 4K at 60 FPS. They were gracious and suggested I return it, and added that they will have HDMI 2.0 compliant switches at the end of the year. Hopefully with the same PIP features. Until then, my monitor has multiple inputs (but no remote) so I'll have to deal with it until then.
customer_reviews.author: Fish Tech

customer_reviews.title: Great switch
customer_reviews.text: My area is currently going through the Spectrum switch to all TV's having a box and a friend asked me to figure out a way to allow him to use the new cable box as well as his existing Apple TV and Sony Blu-Ray player. His TV only had 2 HDMI inputs so this was the perfect solution. We now have the cable box on HDMI 1 and his Apple and Sony connected through the switch on HDMI2 and working perfectly. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin 805

customer_reviews.title: Great Switch. Girlfriend's Family Is Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I helped my girlfriend out by finding this for her. Her family has multiple consoles (Xbox 360, Xbox One, Wii and Wii U) so I was looking for something that made input switching as simple and user friendly as possible. This has worked perfectly. The automatic signal detector frees you from having to manually switch the input. My only complaint (which really isn't that big) regarding the detector is that it takes about 5 seconds before it switches inputs. So far, there have been no instances where the HDMI Switch automatically switches inputs unless the console was turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: No Instructions  Fortunately got it working by trial and error
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in good order and I eventually got it to work to my satisfaction. My dropping the rating to four stars is that there were absolutely no instructions included that gave any useful information about installation setup etc. After a couple of hours of trial and error I finally got it working. Good product, no excuse for the lack of documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Johnson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy this little HDMI switch
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this little HDMI switch! Hopefully it'll last a long time! So far I have my PS4, Switch, computer and cable box connected to it. Does the job and I personally like the little lights on it. Switches when I tell it to, and the pip feature is what sold me on this product. I don't like that I can't make the pip bigger though. :/ Edit: After a couple of months it finally stopped working. I'm not sure why. It just suddenly stopped. :(
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Fixed Issues with previous passively powered auto-switcher
customer_reviews.text: I have a somewhat unique setup where I am retrofitting HDMI onto an older CRT. I was daisy chaining through an HDMI to VGA adapter and then a HDMI auto-switcher to provide guest HDMI and SteamLink. Often, the TV wouldn't receive a signal or the PC would think nothing was connected. I tried giving this 3-in-1 powered HDMI switch a try and it works perfectly. Precedence for auto-selecting seems to be higher numbered inputs which is perfect for my scenario. TV doesn't go to sleep, guest HDMI recognizes correctly, and no more random hissing on the audio path that I used to get. I'm going to get another one of these for my other setup!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Taylor

customer_reviews.title: No Sound
customer_reviews.text: Picture was good, but no sound. The whole point of HDMI is to have quality picture and sound in 1 chord, and when you have multiple devices, a splitter should function. Perhaps good QA would be to connect 4 devices in the inputs and then 1 on the out, turn em all on and check sound and video on everything before boxing?? Anyways, disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: ... about a day now and have mostly fell in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using it for about a day now and have mostly fell in love with it, I've only one complaint that I have, I am a live streamer and I wish it just wouldn't automatically switch inputs when something gets turned on and the remote was a little higher quality, it barely even accepts the proper inputs right up against it but the quality is really high it seems otherwise really well-made there's not even any lag when I switch inputs so it just works flawlessly in my opinion, I also don't notice any quality drops like I did with other switching devices or any more latency
customer_reviews.author: Wes hankinson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Reasons I chose this model: Reasonable price, more slots than others, all the slots are on the back (many other models with 4 slots have one on the front). The feature that automatically switches inputs is great. I haven’t had to use the remote at all. I did have an issue where my xbox360 didn’t want to cooperate with this device at first, a known issue with lots of switchers, but power cycling the xbox solved that problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Logitech Harmony products
customer_reviews.text: I've had this HDMI switch for several months and it works like a champ every single time. This is the perfect HDMI switch for anyone wanting to automate there AV system with a Logitech remote or hub. What's best about this HDMI switch is that it is compatible with Logitech devices so it's super easy to set up routines to automatically switch between devices. Better yet, it's affordably-priced. :-) I would definitely buy one again and I'm considering getting one with more than 3 ports.
customer_reviews.author: Shadels

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: After trying a few other HDMI switches, I came to try this one and glad I did! It's easy to use, all cords are on the back side to easier to hide, and the lit up display makes it easy to see what is connected and which device is currently active. A far superior unit for the price range. My only issue is that the remote is temperamental. I have to intentionally point it directly to the switch unit and be definitive and firm in pressing the button associated with/assigned to the device I want to activate!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. Didn’t see all the recent bad reviews until I received it and was trying to troubleshoot. Do not buy. This should not be carried in stores. Their website is a joke and their support is nonexistent. Literally got a 404 when I clicked on the link to download the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Beth1723

customer_reviews.title: Video cuts out
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this unit which I needed to run two 1080p and one 4k input into a Samsung 4k TV. The worst is connecting a PC at 1080p which causes the box to blank out at random times taking around 5-10 seconds to resume. The best device is the Nintendo Wii using an HDMI adapter. Too bad I missed the return window by 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: enr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device !
customer_reviews.text: This switch has excelled in all my expectations. The controller is nifty , that ease of use and setup is great. The packaging was simple. Here is a breakdown on why this is a must : 1: easy to setup 2: ease of use 3: great quality for your money Now I know it’s made of plastic , but this is not something that’s Going to move from that spot. Overall I’ve been very impressed with how it played out in my set up. The picture in picture mode is also a nice benefit although I wish the actual picture was a little bigger but overall great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I am a technician; I know how all of this works. Even if I weren't a tech, anyone could figure this out! I have the switch plugged in. HDMI-out securely in, as well as HDMI-in, port 1. The remote control doesn't work (yes, I took the plastic tab out of the remote to make sure the battery had contact to function). The switch is stuck on HDMI-in 3 and the switch button on the switch itself doesn't manually change in input! Power cycled the device multiple times. Still not working. The thing is essentially bricked!
customer_reviews.author: James Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: I am replacing this product
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 input units. 99% of the time my Roku Is active while a DVR and an Apple TV are powered down. Frequently, it leaves the Roku port and shows a dark screen, then it jumps back. This keeps happening until I use the remote to force it to a dead port then force it to the Roku port. Then, it’s good for the rest of the night. This is a pain! I wrote to their support and got no reply. As such, I’m ordering from a different vendor and tossing this switch!
customer_reviews.author: Jay & Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the price & performance
customer_reviews.text: I am in the a/v business and very impressed at quality for price.It worked as a replacement to a `high end` $200 unit that was failing,yet this one answered the bell and beyond.VERY impressed.Will order more to carry on our van. Added bonus,was in a major mfr remote database to make the transition easy for client using univ remote...GREAT!!
customer_reviews.author: njrapid

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for all my consoles.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical, but I have to admit, this eased a lot of logistical problems for my entertainment center. I have four game consoles plus a Chromecast, and I was really tired of unplugging things. This device puts all consoles on one input and the picture quality and performance is exactly the same. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Hudgens

customer_reviews.title: Great way to increase your HDMI input flexibility
customer_reviews.text: With only 2 HDMI inputs and the FIOS box hogging one we needed a way to connect additional HDMI devices to the TV. Well this works well and can handle a total of 4 so it gives you three more than you had previously. You can see what's connected and what the active device is by the LEDs on the front.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Santos
